Detailed Description

The command line option list consists of objects of this class.

Definition at line 332 of file CommandlineOptionHandler.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CommandlineOptionHandler::Option::Option (  const char *  shortName,
const char *  longName,
value_t  valueType,
uint32  nbrValues,
void *  optionValue,
const char *  defaultValue,
const char *  helpText
) 
 

Create one option and set all the necessery values,.

Parameters:
shortName The shortname of this option (e.g 'h').
longName The long name of this option (e.g "help")
valueType The type of the variable where the value will be stored.
nbrValues The number of values for this option.
optionValue Pointer to the variable where the value will be stored.
defaultValue The defaultvalue of this option.
helpText Help that will be displayed to the user.

virtual CommandlineOptionHandler::Option::~Option (   )  [virtual]
 

Delete this object.

NB! If there are any strings among the options that have been allocated here they are not deleted since they probably will be used somewhere else!

Member Function Documentation

bool CommandlineOptionHandler::Option::hasValue (  const MC2String &  option  )  const [inline, virtual]
 

Find out if this option have a value or not.

Parameters:
option The name of the option actrually used on the commandline.
Returns:
True if this option has a value (e.g. n 8) and false otherwise (e.g -h ).

Reimplemented in CommandlineOptionHandler::SingleChoiceOption.

Set the default value of this option.

virtual bool CommandlineOptionHandler::Option::setValue (  const uint32  index,
const MC2String &  newVal,
const MC2String &  option
)  [virtual]
 

Set the value corresponding to the given string.

Parameters:
index The value index to set, 0 <= index < nbrValues.
newVal The new value of this option. Stored in the variable pointed to by the m_optinoValue-member.
option The actual option string found on the commandline. Should match either shortName or longName of the Option.
Returns:
True if the value is set, false otherwise.

Reimplemented in CommandlineOptionHandler::SingleChoiceOption.

Referenced by setDefaultValue().

MC2String CommandlineOptionHandler::Option::defaultValue
 

The default value of this option.

Must be of the type given in the valueType-field.

uint32 CommandlineOptionHandler::Option::nbrValues
 

The maximum number of values.

The most comman value of this must be 1, that indicate that only one value is allowed for this option.
